intro: Bistorta ochotensis, commonly known as the Siberian bistort, is a perennial herb native to the cold regions of Siberia and northern Asia. It belongs to the Polygonaceae family, which includes plants known for their rhizomatous growth and distinctive leaf structures. The plant features upright, reddish stems that are often covered with fine hairs, and its leaves are lance-shaped with a prominent midrib. Bistorta ochotensis produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in dense, cylindrical clusters, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, acidic soils and is often found in alpine or subarctic environments.
